goal.ch:
（本學期以中文授課。The course is taught in Chinese this semester.）
資料科學是一門古老又新穎的主題，它起源於幾個世紀以來對統計學的探索，在近二十年內又因收集資料和電腦計算的速度大幅增加，出現了許多潛力無窮的新概念與模型。本課程歡迎具有統計學與程式設計基礎的您，透過閱讀與專題實作的方式深入了解目前在環境科學領域熱門的統計模型，以及要怎麼利用這些模型解構地球系統的運作。
goal.en:
（本學期以中文授課。The course is taught in Chinese this semester.）
Data science is an ancient yet novel subject that originated from centuries of exploration in statistics. In the past two decades, it has seen significant advancements due to the rapid increase in data size and computing speed. Many promising new concepts and models have emerged. This course welcomes individuals with a background in statistics and programming. Through reading and hands-on projects, you will delve into cutting-edge statistical models in environmental science and learn how to use these models to decompose the ways the Earth‘s system runs.

outline.ch:
完整課程大綱: https://whyjz.github.io/ncu-env-data-science-zhtw/syllabus.html
本課程將需要你具備統計學和程式設計的必要知識。可以先閱讀此網頁：https://scikit-learn.org/1.4/tutorial/statistical_inference/supervised_learning.html，如果英文是主要的障礙，可以使用 Google 翻譯或類似的瀏覽器外掛。如果你能在合理的閱讀時間內理解大部分內容和步驟，那麼這門課應該蠻適合你！
Part 1
統計檢定：環境因子間有無相互影響？ (Weeks 3-4)
Part 2
回歸模型：為什麼正則化如此重要？ (Weeks 6-7)
Part 3
神經網路：如何相信深不見底的模型？ (Weeks 8-9)
Part 4
核方法：維度是詛咒也是祝福？ (Weeks 10-11)
Part 5
隨機森林：一個模型不夠就多做幾次？ (Weeks 12-13)
Part 6
期末團隊專題發表 (Week 16)
其他資料科學的主題（例如主成份分析、聚類分析等等）則是指定閱讀的材料，我們會課堂上進行互動式討論。
程式設計作業可以使用任何語言完成，不過我對 Python 與 Matlab 比較熟，能提供比較多協助。作業的參考作法會以 Python 寫成。
outline.en:
Full syllabus: https://whyjz.github.io/ncu-env-data-science-zhtw/syllabus.html
I recommend you acquire the necessary knowledge about statistics and programming before taking this course. Check out this web page: https://scikit-learn.org/1.4/tutorial/statistical_inference/supervised_learning.html -- if you can understand most of the ideas and steps presented here within a reasonable reading time, then you are ready for some new challenges from this course :)
Part 1
Statistical Tests: Are there interactions between environmental factors? (Weeks 3-4)
Part 2
Regression Models: Why is regularization so important? (Weeks 6-7)
Part 3
Neural Networks: How to trust deep models that seem like black boxes? (Weeks 8-9)
Part 4
Kernel Methods: Is dimensionality a curse or a blessing? (Weeks 10-11)
Part 5
Random Forests: When one model is not enough, make several? (Weeks 12-13)
Part 6
Final hacker group presentation (Week 16)
Other topics in data science (such as principal component and clustering analysis) will be covered through assigned readings, which we rely on during the class discussion.
Programming assignments can be completed using any language, but I am familiar with Python and Matlab and can assist if you use either. The assignment example workflows use Python.
